article:
, the Senators' former captain]] The Ottawa Senators are a professional ice
hockey team based in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. They are members of Division C
of the Eastern Conference of the National Hockey League (NHL). The Senators
joined the NHL in 1992 as an expansion franchise. and as of the
conclusion of the 2010â11 NHL season, have made the Stanley Cup playoffs 12 of
the last 13 seasons. 286 different players have worn the Senators
jersey as of the end of the 2011â12 season; of them, 29 are goaltenders, while
257 are skaters.

Daniel Alfredsson and Erik Karlsson are the only players in franchise history
to win major individual awards in the NHL, winning the Calder Memorial Trophy
in 1996 and James Norris Memorial Trophy in 2012, respectively. Alfredsson was
captain of the Senators from 1999-2013, and is the team's all-time leader in
regular season and playoff goals, assists and total points. Alfredsson leads
the Senators in games played with 1,178; Chris Phillips is second with 1,073
appearances. Chris Neil is the all-time leader in penalty minutes accrued,
with 2,005 minutes in 779 games in the regular season, and 192 minutes in 91
playoff games.

Patrick Lalime holds team records in most goaltending categories. Lalime leads
all goaltenders in franchise history with regular season and playoff
appearances, wins, and shutouts.
